content.description:
Augustus Caesar, divi genus, aurea condet
saecula qui rursus Latio regnataregno, -are, -avi, -atum = rego, -ere per arva
SaturnoSaturnus, -i, m.: the god Saturn quondamquondam, adv.: once, formerly, super et GaramantasGaramantas = acc. pl., Garamantians (a people from north Africa) et IndosIndi, -orum, m. pl.: Indians 
proferetprofero, -ferre: to advance, bring forward imperium.
content.question: In his allusion to Saturn in line 3, Vergil draws attention to the fact that Saturn

choices.label: was the ruler of the Underworld
was the god of the seas and freshwater bodies
ruled over a mythical past of abundance and peace

content.answer: ruled over a mythical past of abundance and peace

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12

skill.text: 2.B: Describe historical and cultural contexts of Latin texts.
